definition:
The skull. [Obs.]

A shoal of fish. Milton.

1. (Naut.) (a) A boat; a cockboat. See Sculler. (b) One of a pair of short oars worked by one person. (c) A single oar used at the stern in propelling a boat. 2. (Zo√∂l.)  The common skua gull. [Prov. Eng.]

To impel (a boat) with a pair of sculls, or with a single scull or oar worked over the stern obliquely from side to side.

To impel a boat with a scull or sculls.
